data.title: Lenser: Measure weak gravitational flexion
data.name: Lenser
data.description: A tool for measuring weak gravitational flexion

evidence: "Lenser is a fast, open-source, minimal-dependency Python tool for estimating weak gravitational lensing signals, particularly flexion, from real survey data or realistically simulated images."

"run_real_gal/lenser_run_real_gal_single_fit.py: Imports a real galaxy image and then runs it through Lenser in single-fit mode" and multiple example scripts show it is run as an end-user analysis tool, not just a library.

"(c) Evan J. Arena (Drexel University Department of Physics), 2020." and "Significant contributions to this work have been made by Joseph M. Fabritius II and David M. Goldberg of Drexel University." indicating a university research group context.
